problem: Find $h(x)$, with terms in order of decreasing degree, if  \[9x^3-3x+1+h(x)=3x^2-5x+3.\]
chatgpt_solution: First, we rewrite the given equation as \[\begin{aligned} (9x^3+0x^2-3x+1)+(h(x)-3x^2+5x-3) &= 0. \end{aligned}\]Every term must cancel, which forces $h(x) = \boxed{-9x^3+3x^2+8x+2}$.
